intro: Diodia senensis, commonly known as the Indian borage, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Diodia senensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
